page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO KENDAL
page.content: The town of Kendal{(Kentdale)}has been supplying the needs of its citizens since before the last Domesday survey. Its large{Parish Church}with its relic of a Saxon cross stands on the site of a church mentioned in the first Domesday Survey.Kirkbie Kendal is the name carried to this day by our school.A further link is provided by the name of the main street which is called{Stricklandgate}where for centuries cattle (stirks) were driven along the road(gate) to pastureland in the North. The town is sheltered from the W.by a carboniferous limestone outcrop {Cunswick Scar,(200m)}whose thin dry soil supports Herdwick and Swaledale sheep and slopes down to the lusher boulder clay and alluvium pastures where Fresian dairy and crossbred cattle are reared.
